website_summaries.verdict: Evoluent's updated VerticalMouse 3 refines its longtime ergonomic mouse product into a robust modern competitor. It lacks the wireless freedom of Microsoft's recent ergo mouse, but otherwise, it's just as comfortable, more feature-packed, and better designed. Just don't be afraid of its unorthodox looks.
pros: Keeps your arm even straighter than the competition (assuming that's ergonomically sound)
DPI toggle button with LED indicator
software allows you to configure application-specific button profiles
cons: DPI-switching button inconveniently located on the bottom of the mouse

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this house almost 10 years ago and it still works alright. The moose wheel stopped working a while ago, but the rest works just like it did on the first day. I never ever feel like the mouse is sluggish or that the buttons don't work 100%.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Castle

customer_reviews.title: Best mouse yet
customer_reviews.text: In an effort to avoid carpal tunnel in this computer-oriented world I have tried trackpads, balls and optical mice. By far, the Vertical Mouse is my favorite. I used the Version 1 VM for years, when it got fried with a jolt of static. I delayed ordering a new one; trying my various options from my graveyard of mice - then finally went back to this one. Somewhat expensive, I realize especially because your computer probably came with a free (aka cheap) one - I like this mouse better than a wireless one I've tried. If you're into graphics AT ALL and aren't using a tablet; this is the mouse for you!
customer_reviews.author: K. Mendelowitz

customer_reviews.title: It Really Works!
customer_reviews.text: This really does work. I was resorting to using my mouse with the left hand at work and right hand at home in an attempt to spread out the discomfort. I took a chance on this vertical mouse and "Wow!" It really works. It took 2 - 3 days before I was 100% comfortable, but now I don't notice the difference at all. The nagging soreness in my right wrist and fore arm is completely gone. The mouse is of good quality construction that is soft and smooth. The wheel also turns smoothly and the buttons are responsive. It is overall a good quality mouse in addition to being ergonomically correct.
customer_reviews.author: Who Knows

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: After trying the Evoluent Vertical Mouse for a few weeks, I went back to my standard mouse. I found the button action somewhat hard, and the action to move my hand from the mouse back to the keyboard didn't seem as natural as with a lower-profile mouse. I also felt like I was working harder to hold my arm up than with a standard mouse. On the plus side, I liked the ability to customize the buttons in different ways, and the product seemed to be of good quality. Although this wasn't the right product for me, it might be perfect for someone else, especially if hand/wrist position is a concern.
customer_reviews.author: gingerpeach123

customer_reviews.title: Awkward mouse, helped my wrist but hurt my hand
customer_reviews.text: I tried this device for about 3 months a while back. It helped me at the beginning by reducing the tension on my wrist, but then it began generating pain along the edge of my hand, so I stop using it. The idea is interesting and valid, the natural position for the wrist is sideways and not twisted down. The problem is that there is no base to rest the lower edge of the hand, so that part gets stressed out. Of course everybody's ergonomics needs are not the same, but I recommend instead the, which have been working great for me (3 years now).
customer_reviews.author: Viktor

customer_reviews.title: It helped my carpal tunnel
customer_reviews.text: My carpal tunnel was really bothering me, so I decided to find some help. I came across this vertical mouse & I have to say that my CP is MUCH better now. It was easy to learn, because the fingers are basically the same, although, I did program the middle one to be double click, instead of right click & then I made my ring finger to be the right click. 'More convenient. The only negative is the speed setting. The slowest is too slow & the next one up is a little too fast for me, but it's a trade off that I can live with.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Ann

customer_reviews.title: Loved this mouse
customer_reviews.text: I used this mouse for several years at work. Really helped with the hand fatigue of sitting at a computer all day. Instantly solved the pain in my wrist & forearm. It was also easy to adjust to, since it is just a regular mouse turned sideways. Only improvement would be to make it cordless. I loved the programmable keys as well, and that came in handy. They were very simple to program, and easy to change if needed. Has held up great with daily use for several years.
customer_reviews.author: JessicaT

customer_reviews.title: Really helps with lateral epycondylitis
customer_reviews.text: I have a computer-based job and repetitive "mousing" caused me to develop severe lateral epycondylitis (a/k/a tennis elbow). The vertical mouse really helps relieve the stress and pain. Zero learning curve -- it's very intuitive. A little clunky on the desktop (although it looks cool) and took awhile to learn to quit knocking it off the desk (I'm not used to avoiding a mouse that sticks up like that), but for the record, it can take several bad falls onto a hardwood floor and still keep on working just fine!
customer_reviews.author: Aderyn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Mouse - Excellent Company
customer_reviews.text: As a graphic designer, I bought this mouse 3 years ago when I started having carpal tunnel problems. Within a couple days of having the mouse, my wrist problems were gone and never came back, even when "mousing" for hours every day. The mouse worked excellently for years. Then, it started to malfunction. I wrote to the company and found that I was out-of-warranty by about a month. However, they still took the returned mouse and gave me a replacement. How many companies would do THAT today?! Not many. In the meantime, I've bought two more of this mouse for other family members. I can't say enough good things about the mouse or the company.
customer_reviews.author: S. L. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: The best mouse design so far
customer_reviews.text: I just started using the mouse and already know I won't go back. The concept is so simple you'll wonder what took so long. You're basically holding a mouse sideways while it rests on the pad. And this means your wrist is in a natural position. Multiple buttons allow you to choose what works for you. I hate roller wheels and don't need to use it or notice even notice it on this mouse. But it works too for those who want it. My only gripe is I have larger hands and offering a somewhat larger version as 3m does would get the product every single star rating. Don't wait until that version is offered however, save your wrists now.
customer_reviews.author: DW in Astoria, NY

customer_reviews.title: good service
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one of these. I had the original model for over 5 years and it saved my arm. Unfortunately, Evoluent did not create new drivers for my old one and as Microsoft updated over the years, the drivers ceased to work properly forcing me to buy a new model. I like this one, it's a speed demon, but I am very unhappy with the manufacturer for not keeping up the drivers. It's like Quicken does now, their product will work for 2 years for online banking and after that, you gotta buy the latest version.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse, but not the perfect solution.
customer_reviews.text: Initially your wrist is going to hurt after using this mouse because you will be using new muscles. But give it a few weeks and it will hurt much less. If you're looking for an out of the box solution though you will be disappointed. I've been using it for about 2 months now, and work a lot, about 50 hours a week on a computer with an ergo-chair and this mouse. The good news is my pain in my wrist is less, but I still experience some pain, just in a different part of my wrist with this mouse. Overall though, I would definately recommend it over a standard mouse.
customer_reviews.author: K. Winter

customer_reviews.title: Just what the doctor ordered.
customer_reviews.text: I use computers alot, at home and at work. I had developed a severe pain in my forearm. My doctor told me to look into the ergonomics of my workstations. After looking at a few ergonomic mouses, this seemed like a good choice. I am very pleased with the quality, but was realy suprised with how easy it is to use. I expected an adjustment period, but I picked up on using it instantly. I do also concentrate more on better posture now, but I think this mouse has been a big part of clearing up my problem.
customer_reviews.author: Computer dad

customer_reviews.title: great ergonomic solution
customer_reviews.text: I have to work hours with the mouse. 2004 I began to have problems with my hand, some kind of inner pain. I don't know if it was the Carpal Tunnel Syndrome. After some research, I decide to buy the Evoluent Mouse II. It is very easy and quick (one day) to get used to it. In my case, the mouse was a success. Therefore I have bought another one: the Evoluent Mouse III. I recommend to use also a wrist rest and, very important, an arm support (like ergorest).
customer_reviews.author: Mark R

customer_reviews.title: The pain went away!
customer_reviews.text: I was beginning to have some real problems with Carpal Tunnel Syndrome; pain, itchy palm, and more. As soon as I'd touch a mouse the pain would start. I ordered the vertical mouse and as soon as I started using it, I could feel a difference. NO PAIN! Now, even when doing other things that used to irritate my wrist, there is less (or no) pain because my wrist and arm are getting a rest while on the computer now. I can't emphasize enough how cool this mouse is.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Laserone

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I keep it at work, where I do a lot of spreadsheets, so I do a lot of clicking. My hand would hurt a lot after a day of this sort of work. Now, that I have this product, the pain is substantially less. During spreadsheet-intensive times (a week or so with nothing but spreadsheets), however, even this mouse doesn't help, so I switch back to a regular mouse for short periods of time just to give my hand a break by doing a different type of movement.
customer_reviews.author: N. Stoianova

customer_reviews.title: Good mouse helps most pain
customer_reviews.text: I'm a software developer so I spend a lot of time in front of a computer. I bought thsi mouse because I have been having pain in my wrist, hand and fingers on my mousing hand. The mouse almost immediately fixed the wrist pain because I no longer move my wrist side to side. It has helped the hand pain somewhat, but my fingers still bother me. I guess it's from the clicking. Good product anyway, just dont expect it to be a magical solution.
customer_reviews.author: Remo

customer_reviews.title: My one and only
customer_reviews.text: This is my second, my first belonged to my old office and after leaving I had to purchase one for myself. The Evoluent mouse being at 90 degrees from every other mouse decreases the strain on my forearm, wrist, and elbow. My hand appreciates the new positioning. =-) I've looked for others that would have a similar style but this brand seems to have the one and only. I'll be using this one at work and home from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Shellieme

customer_reviews.title: Saves my wrists every day
customer_reviews.text: I spend many hours a day on my computer - I have significant wrist pain and no gel-pad was helping. I bought this mouse and it make my day a lot easier on me. I wish they offered it in 'sizes' because I have big hands and it is a little small - I'm assuming they struck a 'happy medium' here because half of the other posts say its too big! Either way, its a great mouse and I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: R. Martini

customer_reviews.title: Eases carpal tunnel issues
customer_reviews.text: My wrist flares up once in a while, so I got this for work. It's very comfortable and while it seems foreign at first, you quickly adjust and can't live without it. I gave it a 4 because it seems like it should come in sizes - one for men with large hands and one for women. It seems a little tall for me, but it did help with my wrist so maybe it's just me getting used to it. I would recommend trying it.
customer_reviews.author: sammama

customer_reviews.title: Effective Design....poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my second Evoluent, because after 5 months I had to send my first one back after the scroll wheel began sticking infuriatingly. Guess what? 4 months later my mouse wheel is sticking on the new mouse. I must say they were very prompt about sending me a new mouse, but an $80 mouse (That's what it was when I bought it) should last a long time - I've had my logitech at home for years! It did help with my wrist pain though.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Works for Me
customer_reviews.text: I like this mouse. I bought it after having a sharp pain in my right wrist from using a standard mouse from just web browsing and moving files around. I found the Evoluent easy to set up and to get used to. While a bit expensive, my wrist pain hasn't returned, so I've found it worth it. The only change from my old mouse is that you have to wake-up the computer from standby or hibernation from the computer "on" button. You can't from the USB Evoluent mouse (and USB keyboard).
customer_reviews.author: Daryl J.

customer_reviews.title: Had numbness in hand
customer_reviews.text: Using the computer mouse had become almost impossible until I purchased and began to use this mouse. I love it. I hope to get a wireless one next. When I borrow other people's computers and use a standard mouse the discomfort and numbness return. This is a great mouse for me. I can use it for hours. At first it seemed awkward to use but I quickly became comfortable with it. I am female age 53. UPDATE: I am still using this wonderful mouse daily and I have had NO MORE numbness problems. This mouse has been a miracle no kidding!!!January 26, 2014
customer_reviews.author: T. Vigil

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't solve the problem

I use a mouse about eight hours a day for cad work and was hoping this would solve the problem of that icy cold feeling, numbness and pain--but it did not. I rate it 4 stars because it is no better and no worse than a regular mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Lnd Svyr

customer_reviews.title: Cured my wrist pain!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this along with a Microsoft Ergonomic Keyboard to ease wrist pain. I'm a video editor who is glued to a computer. This thing really did the trick. I got used to it very quickly. It has a PPI selection switch on the bottom, which I thought was really cool. I accidentally knock it over a lot because it is tall, but it feels great in my hand. Cured my wrist pain!
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Save yourself from carpal tunnel!
customer_reviews.text: In my mid-twenties, I was already starting to feel soreness on my wrists from working on the computer. Knowing that this is a serious condition, I was proactive about it and switched to a vertical mouse. It took a week or so to get used it, but once I did, there was no turning back. The soreness was gone and didn't come back. The old horizontal mouse should go the way of the trackball and be phased out already.
customer_reviews.author: K. Cabrera

customer_reviews.title: Evoluent Mouse Good Choice
customer_reviews.text: Overall pleased. The quality is good. For me, it was very easy to get used to. The buttons are in the right positions. No big learning curve from traditional mouse. I want this exact mouse in a little bit smaller size. Even a little bit large for my small hands, it has really helped my shoulder. Thinking about getting another one for other computer.
customer_reviews.author: J.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable mouse that seems more natural
customer_reviews.text: I work on the computer full time every week and started having arm/hand pains. I was told about this mouse and decided to give it a try. It does seem more natural of a hand position and it is comfortable. It seems to be well made as well. It took a few days to get used to it, but I then became very comfortable with it. I still have some arm pains on busy days, but I am also working with trying to have a better sitting posture.
customer_reviews.author: AMP5

customer_reviews.title: Good but not so good at the same time
customer_reviews.text: When i first recieved my verti mouse i was impressed. I work on a computer 9 hours out of the day and wanted a more ergo mouse and thought this was the answer. After a week of using it i would say that although it is somewhat comfortable your ability to click on things is severally hindered. For this reason i sold it to a buddy and went back to a regular mouse. Construction is top notch though.
customer_reviews.author: Juicegoose

customer_reviews.title: Evoluent mouse
customer_reviews.text: I thought this mouse would really be very comfortable, but it is not so. Maybe it takes getting used to, but even though I use it with a small wrist pillow, it is not comfortable enough. Also, It allows for personalizing the buttons and the speed with which it moves, and that is good. It has been easier to use since then. But it still has a somewhat "choppy" movement, not a soft one and the mouse jumps around a bit even though I set it for small movement synchronization. I don't think it is all that it is expected to be.
customer_reviews.author: CE Carr

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: I sit at a laptop all day long and I was having a lot of arm and shoulder pain as well as pain in my first finger from constantly clicking the mouse even though I already had an undermount tray and a pretty good ergonomic set up. I bought this mouse and set it up so my thumb performs the single click and the pain has almost completely disappeared. The mouse is large and bulky. Not sure if it needs to be that way or not. But I would recommend it if you're having problems with the traditional mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: It would be better to make your workspace more ergonomic
customer_reviews.text: Awkward. Didn't really help alleviate wrist pain. It would be better to make your workspace more ergonomic, wear a wrist brace, take breaks, and invest in a high quality traditional mouse.
customer_reviews.author: J. K.

customer_reviews.title: Best Mouse Ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best mouse ever. I have 2 of them, one for at home and one for at work. It is ergonimically correct because you hold your wrist in a neutral position. I highly recommend. Anybody who does a lot of computer work and uses a mouse should use one even as a preventative measure. Once you use this mouse, you'll never want to switch back. It's worth the little extra money that is spent.
customer_reviews.author: Terri

customer_reviews.title: Recommended, especially if you have problems with carpal tunnel
customer_reviews.text: Evoluent mice work really well for me. There is a noticeable decrease in discomfort in my right hand, which has a recurring and light case of repetitive motion strain. Recommended, especially if you have problems with carpal tunnel.
customer_reviews.author: Koop

customer_reviews.title: Amazed at how much of a difference this made
customer_reviews.text: I've had chronic shoulder-forearm-hand pain on my right side for maybe 10 years. My ring and pinky finger go numb after only 10 minutes at the computer. My work requires me to be at the computer all day, so I was getting really discouraged. I've tried everything from chairs, keyboards, foot rests, desks to get around this pain. It's not as if it's gone, but I can't quite believe how big a difference this mouse made after only one day of use. My fingers aren't numb. My pain is reduced by about 50%, which puts it in the completely manageable zone. I'm very grateful for this device.
customer_reviews.author: S. Piver

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable for my injured wrists.
customer_reviews.text: For a guy with diagnosed carpel tunnel, this has been the most comfortable ergo mouse I have ever tried! Really keeps my wrists relaxed by keeping them in a neutral position. Not twisted and tight like a regular mouse. If you don't have carpel tunnel, you should try this mouse anyway!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great, does just what we were looking for in a product.
customer_reviews.author: Lyndal

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I wondered how hard it would be to adjust to this style mouse. Shouldn't have worried, as after a couple of hours of using it I was in heaven. I have recommended this product to everyone I know, and everyone has been happy. Most can't believe they went so long without one.
customer_reviews.author: Cat owner

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I use my mouse alot for CAD work which requires very fine mouse movement. I found it hard to move very small amounts as your wrist isn't resting on surface so much harder to control for precise movement. I'd find myself constantly overshooting desired location
customer_reviews.author: Beach Girl

customer_reviews.title: Rubber Exterior Bubbles and Deriorates
customer_reviews.text: I've used this mouse daily at work for just over two years and in the last few months the rubber coating on the black area of the mouse has started to bubble, deteriorate, and tear. Considering the cost, I would have hoped this product would last longer and be of a higher quality. I do like the mousing action and the way it works. But the quality of the exterior does not match the cost.
customer_reviews.author: RT

customer_reviews.title: Improves over VM2
customer_reviews.text: A great mouse, incorporating a few improvements over the VM2. The VM3 is a little taller than the VM2, and has a subtle lip that extends out under the little finger. Very comfortable and well-fitted for your "average 6' white male" (I thought the VM2 was a bit small). The scroll wheel seems to have fewer, more pronounced cogs than the VM2. The optics now have four DPI modes, and are apparently more sensitive - a surface my VM2 liked is too shiny to give an accurate read on the VM3.
customer_reviews.author: M. Faulkner

customer_reviews.title: As advertised, though a little spendy.
customer_reviews.text: The muscle between my thumb and forefinger hurts sometimes now, but at least it's not the tendons in my wrist and forearm. The pain was totally gone a week or two after beginning to use this mouse. Though more than I wanted to spend on a mouse, it serves its purpose and is probably a bargain for the R&D costs involved on Evoluent's end.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Shear

customer_reviews.title: this mouse + sleeping in the wrist brace really keeps ...

customer_reviews.author: S. Cheever

customer_reviews.title: Vertical Mouse
customer_reviews.text: This Evoluent vertical mouse was a replacement for me. I have been using one for several years now - used to have a lot of trouble with carpal tunnel pain but no more. Marvelous product, sure saved me from pain and possible surgery.

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could say I liked it...
customer_reviews.text: After reading all the other reviews and doing some research, I was really hopeful that this mouse would help my hand, but instead it made it worse. In using this mouse my hand seems to tense up more than with a regular mouse, especially at the base of my thumb, which is where the pain is. After a week of use my thumb and hand hurt much more than usual.
customer_reviews.author: Milsam

customer_reviews.title: Just Caused Different Stress
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I have cubital tunnel. I did not find this mouse to be helpful. All it did was increase stress on my shoulder. I have found that using the computer less has been more effective to me than trying to strain my body in an even more awkward position that this mouse makes you do. Of course, individual results may vary and I applaud any company that even attempts to make things easier. I don't understand how the "handshake" position is any better. Not using the computer period, or using it less, seems to be more effective. good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Sock Questions

customer_reviews.title: Saved me!
customer_reviews.text: My hand always hurt me at work after using my mouse all day. It would also effect my ability to play drums and golf. I recommend also plenty of stretching and conditioning with those that suffer from overuse syndrome. Hope this review helps someone!

customer_reviews.title: Painfully unergonomic
customer_reviews.text: The Evoluent Right Hand VerticalMouse 3 - Silver / Black mouse tries to do the right thing, but for me it turned out to be a pain in the wrist. Because of its weight, it takes a lot of effort to shove this mouse around the desk and it also takes a firm grip. Hmmm. Firm grip, wrist problems. This is not a happy combination. I also had problems with the way the bottom outside edge was shaped, making it uncormfortable to rest my pinkie there. My hands are average-to-large for a woman, so I wonder who this mouse was designed for. Not for me, that's for sure!

customer_reviews.title: Hand Pain decreased Significantly
customer_reviews.text: After suffering from repetitive Motion Pain, for over 8 months, this mouse relieved the pain immediately. I have fairly tiny hands and it still works, with little stress on wrist or metacarpals.
customer_reviews.author: Gail E. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Evoluent mouse doesn't fit my hand
customer_reviews.text: I bought the hype and purchased an Evoluent VerticalMouse3 Rev 2 and used it for a week, increasingly noticing the soreness in my wrist and thumb. I paid attention to my arm position, but I found that I couldn't move the mouse without straining my wrist. It was too big for my hand. Don't buy this if you have less than a normally-sized hand.
customer_reviews.author: Mollie A. Twidale

customer_reviews.title: My old muse was better
customer_reviews.text: I've been using my beloved Intellimouse Optical for about 7 years now, but I was starting to experience some discomfort in my hand and wrist, so figured I would try out an ergonomic mouse. My hand and wrist actually hurt worse after a few days of using this mouse than before I started using it. I don't know if this new model is different than the older ones that have gotten lots of positive reviews here, but I certainly don't recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: WorknMan
